title.narrative: Improving Child Rights among Indigenous People in the Moutamba District

description.narrative: The target area is in the Republic of Congo department of Niari Moutamba District in the village of Tsimba and its surrounding smaller villages Titi Mabafi Itsotso and Koumoutsanga/Mouvouenze. The area is in a vast rainforest where intensive logging has be en going on for some years. The indigenous people (pygmies) has suffered from the logging industry. Their traditional areas of living have been cut for timber. The indigenous people traditionally a nomadic food-gatherer tribe have had to settle down in the surroundings of Tsimba where they are not welcomed by the bantou people and are exploited in many ways. The indigenous people live in poverty and children rarely go to school.The 3-year project aims at promoting the rights of children in the target commun ities especially those of the local indigenous population. The project will concentrate on the children?s right to education but also the rights to clean water and healthy life and the right to an identity will be addressed. The project's overall objective is to assure that the rights of indigenous people?s children to education and good health is fulfilled.Final beneficiaries: a) Rights holders: the children (both indigenous and bantou) in the villages. b) Duty-bearers: district officials (education health youth + sports and social sectors) teachers and parents.Goals:1. The quality of education has improved in the project locations.2. The indigenous people and bantous live together peacefully.3. The rights of children (both indigenous and bantou) to health care and clean water are fulfilled in the project locations.4. Local authorities and other duty-bearers are familiar with indigenous people's and childrens' rights and work for their improvement.Activities: 1) material support (school uniforms school mater ial) for indigenous school children 2) refurbishing of schools 3) material support and training for teachers 4) trainings on human rights for both rights holders and duty-bearers 5) building a deep well 6) health and hygiene campaigns 7) establishing a Lea rning and Media Center and 8) supporting the collaboration of different local actors.Regarding the crosscutting objectives of development policy this project works mainly for reduction of inequality between the indigenous people and bantous and the improve ment of gender equality. Gender equality is improved through e.g. assuring that both girls and boys get access to schools.
